alert.note: Alert for Atchison; Gentry; Harrison; Mercer; Nodaway; Worth (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 7:30AM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Worth, northern Gentry, northwestern Mercer, Atchison, northern Harrison and Nodaway Counties through 800 AM CDT... At 729 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Winterset to 9 miles south of Creston to near Braddyville. Movement was southeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Maryville, Albany, Tarkio, Stanberry, Rock Port, Grant City, Fairfax, Burlington Junction, Hopkins, Ridgeway, Ravenwood, Eagleville, New Hampton, Skidmore, Braddyville, Blanchard, Irena, Conception Junction, Sheridan and Blythedale. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 in Missouri between mile markers 98 and 114. Interstate 29 between mile markers 108 and 123. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CDT for north central and northwestern Missouri.

area.areaDesc: Atchison; Gentry; Harrison; Mercer; Nodaway; Worth
